text: Edward T. Young (October 27, 1858 – September 19, 1940) was an American lawyer and politician. Young was born in Henderson, Minnesota. He received his law degree from University of Minnesota and was admitted to the Minnesota bar in 1881. Young practiced law in Appleton, Minnesota and served as the Appleton City Attorney. He also served on the Appleton City Council and was a Republican. Young served in the Minnesota House of Representatives in 1889 and 1890 and in 1893 and 1894. Young also served in the Minnesota Senate from 1895 to 1902. Young served as the Minnesota Attorney General from 1905 to 1909.Minnesota Legislators Past & Present-Edward T. Young'The Legislative Directory of the State of Minnesota 1901,' Biographical Sketch of Edward T. title: Edward T. Young
